p: Besides, the pyloric ligation model mimics chronic constipation due to stasis of gastric motility, causing the acidic content to remain in contact with the gastric mucosa for a long time. Exposure of the gastric lumen to this accumulation of acid secretion promotes self-digestion of the gastric mucosa and loss of integrity of the mucosal barrier, leading to ulcer instability [ 167]. In this review, the kolaviron [ 138, 139] and baicalein molecules [ 81] were evaluated against this induction method, presenting a gastroprotective effect that can be explained by a possible antisecretory activity (decreasing the production of H +).
